intro: Bulbocodium cruciatum, commonly known as the crucifix bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to blue, bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
